TextView.android:text: PROTEIN SOURCES
Dietary Guidelines for Americans
Protein makes up 10% to 35% of daily Calories. That’s typically 60 grams for the average man. That’s typically 50 grams for the average woman. Protein is for tissue growth and maintenance.
Tofu provides around 20 grams of protein per cup
Edamame beans provide around 17 grams of protein per cup
Tempeh provides around 30 grams of protein per cup
As much protein as beef and lamb: 63 grams per cup
Hemp Seed
Hemp seeds provide around 51 grams of protein per cup
Green Peas
Green peas provide around 8 grams of protein per cup
Lentils provide around 47 grams of protein per cup
Chickpeas (Beans)
Chickpeas provide around 12 grams of protein per cup
Peanuts provide around 37 grams of protein per cup
Almonds provide around 30 grams of protein per cup
Spirulina Seaweed
Spirulina seaweed provides around 65 grams of protein per cup
Chia Seeds
Chia seeds provide around 32 grams of protein per cup
Uncooked quinoa contains about 24 grams of protein per cup
Raw potatoes provide about 3 grams of protein per cup, diced
Raw broccoli provides about 3 grams of protein per cup
Almond Butter
Almond butter provides about 55 grams of protein per cup
Cashew Butter
Cashew butter provides about 45 grams of protein per cup
Others Include...
Protein-rich fruits and vegetables like bananas, guava, etc.
Look for Essential Nutrients
Vitamin A, Vitamin B, Vitamin C, Vitamin D, Vitamin E, Vitamin K, Folic Acid, Calcium, Iron, Zinc, Chromium
